page.title: 08FARMING AND INDUSTRY
page.content: The area in the north of our block is one of{mixed farming and managed {woodland.}The woods are mainly oak and chestnut{copses.}The{grassland supports Friesian cattle and some sheep and horses. Some fields were used for hay and silage in 1985; the rest were sown with{cereals}like oats, barley and maize. One field had sugar beet. Much of the land is privately owned by Glover's Farm and Worsham Farm. The{only large industrial works}in our block is the{brickworks}at Turkey Road. Originally started as the Lunsford Works about 1914, it is now part of{Redland Bricks Ltd.}It makes 4 types of brick from local clays and employs around 80 people. Some people{commute}from Bexhill to London and Brighton, but there is some {unemployment especially amongst youth.
